message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CE

The paper combines topic modelling and Rasch modelling to measure students' academic abilities in MOOCs. This involves both natural language processing and statistical modelling, which suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories. However, given the focus on machine learning and probabilistic modelling, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves text analysis and information retrieval, which could place it in cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) respectively. Additionally, the paper deals with educational data mining, which could place it in cs.CY (Computers and Society) or cs.CE (Computers and Education).
